channel.title: Need a little BCEL help
channel.description:
Well basically some of you may already know me(hint: im Fiori), a lot of others wont. If you don't hello :)
But anyway onto the point, i have basically been fiddling with BCEL a little bit and trying to hook various FIELDs from the client but i have run into a little problem.
The problem seems to be the way i load all of the classes. Well my so called "ClassLoader" loads all the rs classes from a folder into a ClassGen[] Here is its code: http://pastebin.com/m3a38cd11
Now it seems to load them all just fine. The output can be found here: http://pastebin.com/md560a9d
But when i go to outprint the contents of the ClassGen[] i get a null value. A sample of the output looks like this(notice the null value):[code] org.apache.bcel.generic.ClassGen@d96 org.apache.bcel.generic.ClassGen@d97 org.apache.bcel.generic.ClassGen@d98 null org.apache.bcel.generic.ClassGen@d99 org.apache.bcel.generic.ClassGen@d9a org.apache.bcel.generic.ClassGen@d9b org.apache.bcel.generic.ClassGen@6e[/code]
The full output is here(http://pastebin.com/m799b4ec8)
This is a problem, because when my code goes to sift through the values of my ClassGen[], and say creates a PoolGen for each value, it comes to the null and causes a NullPointerException
I apologize that was long, but if anyone could please help i would very much appreciete it.
Thank you, Fiori
EDIT:Here is an output of me looping through all the classes. The nullpointer occures where it says "Null man is gay": http://pastebin.com/m5e6e71ff

item.title: Need a little BCEL help
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

BAsh(CntLgn):

The loop in the fioriLoad method iterates through all the files in that directory. One of the files does not end in “.class” however so when it hits this line: if(f.list()[i].indexOf(".class") != -1) { it skips it. A better solution would be to create an ArrayList of ClassGen, with an initial length of the number of files. When you return simply use toArray(new ClassGen[0]);

Yeah, he created a ClassGen array with 208 spaces, and since the META-INF folder doesn’t end in “.class” the “if(f.list().indexOf(”.class") != -1)" statement doesn’t add it to the ClassGen array (it shouldn’t anyway): one space stays empty, null, causing a NullPointerException.

I agree with the ArrayList thing though, suggested it to him on irc.
^ Edit:
wooo i got it working
arraylists.

Read full topic

item.title: Need a little BCEL help
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

The loop in the fioriLoad method iterates through all the files in that directory. One of the files does not end in “.class” however so when it hits this line: if(f.list()[i].indexOf(".class") != -1) { it skips it. A better solution would be to create an ArrayList of ClassGen, with an initial length of the number of files. When you return simply use toArray(new ClassGen[0]);

Don’t use Repository to load the class as it can pick the classes up from anywhere. There again i would use ASM so you don’t come across the bugs in bcel.

Read full topic

item.title: Need a little BCEL help

item.description:

Well basically some of you may already know me(hint: im Fiori), a lot of others wont. If you don’t hello

But anyway onto the point, i have basically been fiddling with BCEL a little bit and trying to hook various FIELDs from the client but i have run into a little problem.

Now it seems to load them all just fine. The output can be found here:

But when i go to outprint the contents of the ClassGen[] i get a null value. The full output is here(http://pastebin.com/m799b4ec8)

This is a problem, because when my code goes to sift through the values of my ClassGen[], and say creates a PoolGen for each value, it comes to the null and causes a NullPointerException

I apologize that was long, but if anyone could please help i would very much appreciete it.

Thank you,
Fiori
